content.text:
# 45th Academy of Country Music Awards

(5 each)
| most_wins = Miranda Lambert (3)
| network = CBS
| director =
| host = Reba McEntire
| ratings = 12.5 million
| previous = 44th
| main = ACM
| next = 46th
}}The 45th Academy of Country Music Awards were held on April 18, 2010, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada. The ceremony was hosted by ACM Award Winner Reba McEntire.
Winners and nominees
Winners are shown in bold.
{| class="wikitable"
! width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;" |Entertainer of the Year
! width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;" |Album of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* Carrie Underwood
** Kenny Chesney
** Toby Keith
** Brad Paisley
** George Strait
** Taylor Swift
** Keith Urban
** Zac Brown Band
| valign="top" |
* 'Revolution – Miranda Lambert'
** American Saturday Night – Brad Paisley
** Lady Antebellum -– Lady Antebellum
** Play On – Carrie Underwood
** The Foundation – Zac Brown Band
|-

! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Top Male Vocalist of the Year

| valign="top" |

! colspan="2" style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Event of the Year
|-
| colspan="2" |
* '"Hillbilly Bone" – Blake Shelton with Trace Adkins'
** "Honky Tonk Stomp" – Brooks & Dunn with Billy Gibbons
** "I Told You So" – Carrie Underwood with Randy Travis
** "I'm Alive" – Kenny Chesney with Dave Matthews
** "Seeing Stars" – Jack Ingram with Patty Griffin
